definition: sideline/side occupation
secondary/auxiliary/deputy/assistant/vice-/abbr. for 副詞|副词 adverb/classifier for pairs, sets of things & facial expressions
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
surname Ye

sentences.english: For many, driving a taxi is merely a part-time job.
sentences.chinese: 對大多數美國人而言，開計程車只是一種副業。

sentences.english: Why not start a side business doing pet-sitting or training?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼不開辦一個寵物照料或訓練的副業？

sentences.english: You can’t be a leader from the sideline.
sentences.chinese: 你不能成爲副業中的領導者。

sentences.english: It is a fine tradition for our national army that engages agricultural sideline production.
sentences.chinese: 部隊從事農副業生產是我軍的光榮傳統。

sentences.english: Building a side business is one of the best ways to invest in your future.
sentences.chinese: 搭建一個副業是投資於未來的最好方法之一。

sentences.english: We raise ducks as a sideline.
Raising pigs is the best household sideline and a good way of making money for farmers.
sentences.chinese: 養豬是最好的家庭副業，是農民致富的好幫手。

sentences.english: Dance, then, is a great avocation for you.
sentences.chinese: 那麼跳舞對你來說就是一個“副業”。

sentences.english: The people in the village become rich by doing part-time work, so every family builds its new building of two stages.
sentences.chinese: 村裏的人搞副業發了家，戶戶都蓋起了兩層樓的新房。

sentences.english: Bookkeeping is Mr. Jones' vocation, and photography is his avocation.
sentences.chinese: 薄記是瓊斯先生的職業，照相他的副業。

sentences.english: To increase income, they needed to feed pigs and grow vegetables as a sideline.
sentences.chinese: 增加收入，他們需要餵豬和種植蔬菜作爲副業。

sentences.english: He said it is just a part-time job and his main online store is a flower delivery service.
sentences.chinese: 他說這只是副業，他的店主要提供鮮花快遞服務。

sentences.english: Raising white wax insects is very profitable in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 放養白蠟蟲是農村非常有利的副業。

sentences.english: He is a doctor by profession and a novelist by avocation.
sentences.chinese: 他的職業是醫生，副業是作家。

definition: main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to make money
to change profession
obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity
high denomination of banknotes or coins/lots of money/a big sum (e.g. a bribe)
to support a family/to raise a family
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
slack/in a slump
to teach class/to lecture
to pave (with paving stones)/to lay a road/(fig.) to lay the groundwork (for sth)/to give a present to sb to ensure success
in one's spare time/outside working hours/amateur (historian etc)
accountant/accountancy/accounting
labor/able-bodied worker/laborer/work force
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
well qualified/competent/to be equal to the task/able to do sth very well
